column4: Hey guys, I'm trying to make a SIP-call with ubuntu empathy. The sip call seems to be doing fine (it connects, and my pbx passes and connects the call), but I hear absolutely nothing. Sound works fine on the machine otherwise. Any ideas what I might be dopin gwrong?
I just hear nothing, evennot the ring-tones
So you have a setup         your phone -> PBX -> other phone ( in the same network)?
have you checked the logs of your PBX and eventually the logs of empathy?
the pbx seems to do fine (it receives the call, and starts playing a message)
have you checked with another softphone? I left empathy beside as I don't like it and had some problems as well
Then do that before anything else
what would be a decent voip phone?
You were not adviced  you got the hint to test another softphone. That hint came as you mentioned everything with the PBX is alright
Have you any pone connected to your PBX that works correctly?
Okay, then is your Box running a Firewall?
So my hint ( advice ) in the end was correct :)
I think empathy is a peace of crap, but that's jst my opinion
It could be due to having a mixture of pulse audio and alsa
